@Name: Data Element Aggregating an Excessively Large Number of Non-Primitive Elements
Description:
The product uses a data element that has an excessively large
					number of sub-elements with non-primitive data types such as structures or aggregated objects.

xhtml:p: This issue can make the product perform more slowly.  If the relevant code is reachable by an attacker, then this performance problem might introduce a vulnerability.
While the interpretation of "excessively large" may vary for each product or developer, CISQ recommends a default of 5 sub-elements.

Submission.Submission_Comment: Entry derived from Common Quality Enumeration (CQE) Draft 0.9.
